alert.note: Alert for Park (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 7:51PM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: .Recent warm temperatures have resulted in increased snowmelt around the Shields River Valley. This has resulted in increased water moving into the creeks and streams that flow into the Shields River. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small creeks and streams, low-lying areas near the Shields River, and culverts. Rural roads and bridges may be washed out or damaged. Livestock may become stranded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM MDT, emergency management reported minor flooding from snowmelt across portions of the Shields River Valley. Minor flooding is possible on additional small streams. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Clyde Park and Wilsall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
